Title:
Ramularia hydrangeicola sp. nov. on Hydrangea serrata
f. acuminata with distinctive traits
Keywords:
anamorphic Mycosphaerella, Hydrangeaceae, plant pathogen,
phylogenetic analysis
Abstract:
A new species, Ramularia hydrangeicola sp. nov., that
causes leaf spots was observed on leaves of Hydrangea serrata
f. acuminata. Morphological characteristics and phylogenetic analyses
suggest that this fungus represents a distinct new species. The new
fungus was described, illustrated and compared with R. hydrangeae and R.
philadelphi that have been observed on the same plant family.
